Description: Set the organization name as below.
For aais node, set org_name = “aais”,
For analytics node, set org_name = “analytics”
For carrier node, set org_name = “<carrierogname>”. Example org_name = “travelers”.
Note: For aais’s dummy carrier set org_name=”carrier” for others set respective org name.
Set to dev | test | prod
Set to true to create VPC otherwise false for using existing VPC
VPC id when existing VPC is used
Network CIDR for the clusters
List of availability zones for the clusters
List of subnet CIDRs for cluster public subnets
List of subnet CIDRs for cluster private subnets
Choose to provision bastion host
Ingress traffic rules to be allowed for bastion host in the clusters
Egress traffic rules to be allowed for bastion host in the  clusters

Choose whether to create public hosted zone in Route 53. When chosen to create hosted zone, it results name servers after terraform run. These name servers need to be added in the domain registrar under the list of domain’s name servers.
When chosen not to create hosted zone in route 53, it results list of URLs/FQDNs which are required to enter in the domain records.
Be sure to include ‘.com’ in the domain.
Subdomain is optional. leave empty quotes if not applicable
Choose cognito pool to be created
A name to the user pool
“COGNITO_DEFAULT” | “DEVELOPER” depends on email service is Cognito default or SES. Accordingly, setup secrets, SES service.
Application EKS cluster name
Application EKS cluster version.  Refer to https://docs.aws.amazon.com/eks/latest/userguide/kubernetes-versions.html. Prefer n-1 version.
We use the x86 ami.
AMI ID for the EKS worker nodes. Refer to below link to identity the AMI ID based on EKS cluster version and the AWS region
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/eks/latest/userguide/eks-optimized-ami.html
To retrieve AMI ID:
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/eks/latest/userguide/retrieve-ami-id.html
for version 1.20 it would be:
#aws ssm get-parameter --name /aws/service/eks/optimized-ami/1.20/amazon-linux-2-x64/recommended/image_id --region us-east-1 --query "Parameter.Value" --output text
Blockchain EKS cluster name
Blockchain EKS cluster version
Refer to https://docs.aws.amazon.com/eks/latest/userguide/kubernetes-versions.html. Prefer n-1 version.
We use the x86 ami.
AMI ID for the EKS worker nodes. Refer to below link to identity the AMI ID based on EKS cluster version and the AWS region
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/eks/latest/userguide/eks-optimized-ami.html
To retrieve AMI ID:
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/eks/latest/userguide/retrieve-ami-id.html
Choose to enable cloudtrail
Name of the s3 bucket to use with CloudTrail, (NOTE: s3 bucket names should be unique globally). suggest <node_type>-<node_env>-<org_name>-cloudtrail

AWS area: S3 bucket – terraform state – AWS resources
Description: Name of the S3 bucket that would be managing terraform state files of AWS resources (First pipeline backend s3 bucket name)

AWS area: S3 bucket – HDS data analytics (applicable for analytics and carrier nodes only)
Description: Name of the S3 bucket that would be used to store HDS analytics data. This is applicable only for carrier and analytics nodes. For AAIS node set to empty (“”)
Chose to provision s3 public bucket
Name of the S3 bucket that would be used to manage web page images (logos). This bucket would be publicly accessible

Data type: S3 bucket name to store s3 access logs

Description: Choose whether to use existing keys or create KMS keys
KMS key ARN that will be used for encrypting s3 objects
KMS key ARN that will be used for EKS secrets encryption
KMS key ARN that will be used to encrypt coudtrail cloudwatch logs
KMS key ARN that will be used to encrypt VPC flow logs

Data type: KMS key ARN that will be used to encrypt secrets

Description: Enter no of days to retain cloudtrail vpc flow logs and EKS logs
tag2 = "value2"}
Organization name in TFC/TFE
Terraform workspace that manages AWS resources
